title: The Short-Run and Long-Run Effects of Behavioral Interventions: Experimental Evidence from Energy Conservation
control_group_scenario_prompt: You are participating in a household electricity usage study.
intervention_group_scenario_prompt: You are participating in a household electricity usage study.
response_instruction: This is {month_current} ({year_current}). For this month, what is your household electricity consumption in kilowatt-hours (kWh)?
response_options: Please respond with a single number only, without any additional explanation or units.

title: The Short-Run and Long-Run Effects of Behavioral Interventions: Experimental Evidence from Energy Conservation
control_group_scenario_prompt: You are participating in a household electricity usage study.
intervention_group_scenario_prompt:
Last month ({month_prev} ({year_prev})), your household electricity consumption was {user_last_month} kWh, which is {comparison} your neighbors' average of {neighbors_last_month} kWh.
Here is your electricity consumption trend over the past 12 months:
- {Month_1} ({Year_1}): You used {user_value_1} kWh; neighbors' average was {neighbors_value_1} kWh.
- {Month_2} ({Year_2}): You used {user_value_2} kWh; neighbors' average was {neighbors_value_2} kWh.
...
- {Month_12} ({Year_12}): You used {user_value_12} kWh; neighbors' average was {neighbors_value_12} kWh.
{% if avg_diff < 0 %}
On average, over the past 12 months, you used {{ -avg_diff }} kWh less per month than your neighbors, saving you approximately {{ savings }} each month.
{% else %}
On average, over the past 12 months, you used {{ avg_diff }} kWh more per month than your neighbors, which costs you approximately {{ extra_cost }} extra each month.
{% endif %}
response_instruction: This is {month_current} ({year_current}). For this month, what is your household electricity consumption in kilowatt-hours (kWh)?
response_options: Please respond with a single number only, without any additional explanation or units.

title: Boosting vs. nudging sustainable energy consumption: a long-term comparative field test in a residential context
control_group_scenario_prompt:
You are participating in an experiment. This is week {week_num}.
A web link library contains various energy-saving tips for your reference.
As of this week, your cumulative electricity usage is {cumulative_value} kWh.
intervention_group_scenario_prompt:
You are participating in an experiment. This is week {week_num}.
A web link library contains various energy-saving tips for your reference.
Over the past several weeks, your and your friends' weekly electricity usage were as follows:
{Week_1}: You ({user_value_1} kWh), Friends ({friends_value_1} kWh)
...
You have set an energy-saving goal for yourself (10%).
response_instruction: Please output your electricity usage this week (in kWh) and your hot water usage this week (in cubic meters).
response_options: Output two numbers, separated by a comma.

title: Boosting vs. nudging sustainable energy consumption: a long-term comparative field test in a residential context
control_group_scenario_prompt:
You are participating in an experiment. This is week {week_num}.
A web link library contains various energy-saving tips for your reference.
Over the past several weeks, your and your friends' weekly electricity usage were as follows:
{Week_1}: You ({user_value_1} kWh), Friends ({friends_value_1} kWh)
...
You have set an energy-saving goal for yourself (10%).
intervention_group_scenario_prompt:
You are participating in an experiment. This is week {week_num}.
Next to each device in your daily life (e.g., oven, fridge), there is a QR code you can scan to view energy-saving tips specific to that device. It is very convenient. You can scan the QR codes with your phone to receive and store the tips.
As of this week, your cumulative electricity usage is {cumulative_value} kWh.
response_instruction: Please output your electricity usage this week (in kWh) and your hot water usage this week (in cubic meters).
response_options: Output two numbers, separated by a comma.

title: Toward achieving persistent behavior change in household water conservation
control_group_scenario_prompt:
You are participating in an water usage experiment. This is week {week_num}.
Your water usage last period is {user_value} liters/day.
intervention_group_scenario_prompt:
You are participating in an water usage experiment. This is week {week_num}.
Your Water Usage were as follows:
Last week: {user_last_value} liters/day
Week before last: {user_week_before_last_value} liters/day
Previous average: {user_previous_average_value} liters/day
response_instruction: Please estimate the daily household water usage (in liters per day) for this period.
response_options: Give only one number. Do not add any words.

title: Toward achieving persistent behavior change in household water conservation
control_group_scenario_prompt:
You are participating in an water usage experiment. This is week {week_num}.
Your water usage last period is {user_value} liters/day.
intervention_group_scenario_prompt:
You are participating in an water usage experiment. This is week {week_num}.
Here are four practical and motivating tips to save water:
1. Wash fruits in a bowl instead of under running water！you can save a significant amount of water each time.
2. Turn off the tap while soaping your hands or doing laundry！each time you save 10-30 liters, which adds up quickly!
3. Try shortening your shower time！most sailors finish in under 1 minute. You'll not only save water but also have more time for other activities!
Your water usage last period is {user_value} liters/day.
response_instruction: Please estimate the daily household water usage (in liters per day) for this period.
response_options: Give only one number. Do not add any words.
